sermons.title: (2 Samuel) Doing Things God's Way
sermons.description: David, now established as king over Israel, decides to bring the Ark of the Covenant to Jerusalem.  So they get together a large group of worshippers and put the Ark on a brand new cart pulled by oxen and head for Jerusalem.  On the way the cattle stumble and the Ark almost falls to the ground, but is stopped by the hand of Uzzah who is escorting the cart.  The Lord is furious and strikes Uzzah dead on the spot.  David sends the Ark to the house of Obededom and the Lord blesses the house.  David seeks the Lord on how He wants the Ark to be brought back Jerusalem and the Lord instructs him the correct way.  So David brought the Ark back no leaving anything to chance and dances before the Lord with all his might.  But he is despised by his wife Michal for wearing a linen ephod and dancing and she rebukes him when he returns home for this the Lord caused her to be barren for the rest of her life.

sermons.title: (The Path Of The Ark #5) Touching Christ Through Revelation
sermons.description: The death of Uzzah triggered a spiritual crisis for David and the nation.  The Ark's stay at the house of Obed-Edom with blessing sparked hope in David that God can be pleased when he sought Him by revelation of Scripture.  The second parade that escorted the Ark to Jerusalem was by a transformed David dressed no longer as a king but a humble priest 'outside the camp'.

sermons.title: God's Work To Be Done God's Way
sermons.description: It is good to want to work for God. David found out how important it is to do God's work in God's way. From 2 Samuel 6. Although God may honor the world's efforts, his people must only do things the way he has required -- David learned this when he tried to move the ark as the Philistines had, costing Uzzah his life. The Church must never employ the world's methods, for God will only bless the obedience of his people.

sermons.title: Steadying The Ark Of God
sermons.description: Vance Havner shares about how the people of our day have desired to steady the ark, but what we need is to get back to God's ways and His principles. Church needs to get back to God. We have been so anxious to be relevant we have lost our reverence towards God.

sermons.title: Steadying The Ark Of God by Vance Havner
sermons.description: Vance Havner shares about how the people of our day have desired to steady the ark, but what we need is to get back to God's ways and His principles. Church needs to get back to God. We have been so anxious to be relevant we have lost our reverence towards God.

sermons.title: The Glorious Uncovered King of Israel
sermons.description: May 14, 2006 – Jesus Christ filled with compassion moved to bring the worship od God into the central core of humanity. There has to be an inner cry of every christian that desires to honor the Lord with their life. Jesus Christ will come and unveil Himself to the heart of a servant. Those who will serve with the lowest of the low.

sermons.title: When Mercy Kills an Outstretched Hand
sermons.description: This is a very powerful message about the fear of the Lord and the lack of respect in the Church for His presence. This message can be summed up in a single quote from Pastor Conlon, "Lose everything in your life but don't lose the presence of God."

sermons.title: Who's Touching the Ark?
sermons.description: Brother Len speaks on absolute obediance and how it is necessary to walking in God's will; that without this obediance we begin to dry up spiritually. Secondly, he discusses man's dealing with holy things of God, namely the ark of God. The application he preaches on is how we try to dress the gospel up to modernize it. He points out that the man who tried to steady the ark was not blaspheming God, he was not smashing it, or in any way intentionally rebelling against the Lord; but for all this, he was still disobediant and killed on the spot. "A lady called me from the border of Mexico today...she was weeping, she said, '...oh, we do want to be such great soulwinners'...I said to her, my dear look, the first commandment is not, "thou shalt be a soulwinner," the first commandment is, "thou shalt love the Lord thy God..."
